meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Judi Greenberg Chris Desser Keith Bell Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #544.

td.p: Judi Greenberg, a housewife from Northbrook, Illinois
Chris Desser, an attorney from Santa Monica, California
Keith Bell, a personnel specialist from Alexandria, Virginia (whose 4-day cash winnings total $37,051)

tr.td: 1986 FILMS
LONDON
DOUBLE TALK
POTENT POTABLES
THE 20TH CENTURY
[The "TH" was uppercase & the same size as the 20.]
ODDS & ENDS

Chris

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_3_3', 'clue_J_3_3_stuck', '[Chris looked puzzled.]
(Alex: Chris?)
(Chris: Could you repeat the clue, please?)
(Alex: Oh...)
[Alex reread it quickly.]
(Chris: Who is Shirley?)
(Alex: You\'d have to say Shirley Shirley to be consistent with the category.)
[The song was played going into the break.]

Dee Dee Sharp

Chris
')
div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_J_3_3', 'clue_J_3_3_stuck', 'Sharp singer who had her biggest hit with this song:

"A Mashed Potato started long time ago /
With a guy named Sloppy Joe /
You\'ll find this dance is so cool to do /
Come on baby, gonna teach it to you..."')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
Sharp singer who had her biggest hit with this song:
"A Mashed Potato started long time ago /
With a guy named Sloppy Joe /
You'll find this dance is so cool to do /
Come on baby, gonna teach it to you..."

loganberries & boysenberries

KeithChris
')

Chris

(including 2 DDs),

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
